anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu] is now an adult and will meet his destiny. First arc: Saiyajins & Freezer http://anidb.net/ch11418 [Raditz] tells Gokuu of his true origin as a Saiyajin. Gokuu refused to join him, so Raditz kidnaps Gokuu`s son, http://anidb.net/ch11419 [Gohan]. Gokuu sacrifices his life to win the battle. http://anidb.net/ch2105 [Vegeta] & http://anidb.net/ch11415 [Nappa] come down to Earth but are defeated. Vegeta retreats to one of http://anidb.net/ch9009 [Freezer]`s command posts. Gohan, Bulma, and Kuririn get in Kami-sama`s old spaceship and head off towards Namek to collect their Dragon Balls. Second arc: Jinzouningen & Cell The plot centers on 4 jinzouningen who were built to kill Gokuu and fight everyone who tries to protect him. http://anidb.net/ch20915 [Cell], one of the 4 jinzouningen, absorbs 2 of the others to become capable of destroying the universe. Gohan, is the only one who can stop him since he has been shown to be more powerful -- and faster -- than his father. Third arc: Buu http://anidb.net/ch41758 [Buu] is the new threat to Earth, and he turns people into candy to then eat them. Note regarding the US/R1 version and any version based on it (informally, the "US chopjob"): The first 80 episodes of DBZ were cut down to 65. For a listing of the episodes scroll down to the "O" specials and read their episodenames. All other episode were not cut together.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: android
tag.description: An android is a robot or synthetic organism designed to look and act like a human.

tag.name: cyborg
tag.description: A cyborg is a cybernetic organism (i.e. an organism that has both artificial and natural systems). The term was coined in 1960 when Manfred Clynes and Nathan Kline used it in an article about the advantages of self-regulating human-machine systems in outer space. D. S. Halacy`s Cyborg: Evolution of the Superman in 1965 featured an introduction which spoke of a "new frontier" that was "not merely space, but more profoundly the relationship between `inner space` to `outer space` -a bridge...between mind and matter." The cyborg is often seen today merely as an organism that has enhanced abilities due to technology, but this perhaps oversimplifies the category of feedback. Fictional cyborgs are portrayed as a synthesis of organic and synthetic parts, and frequently pose the question of difference between human and machine as one concerned with morality, free will, and empathy. Fictional cyborgs may be represented as visibly mechanical (e.g. the Cybermen in the Doctor Who franchise or The Borg from Star Trek); or as almost indistinguishable from humans (e.g. the "Human" Cylons from the re-imagining of Battlestar Galactica). The 1970s television series The Six Million Dollar Man featured one of the most famous fictional cyborgs. Cyborgs in fiction often play up a human contempt for over-dependence on technology, particularly when used for war, and when used in ways that seem to threaten free will. Cyborgs are also often portrayed with physical or mental abilities far exceeding a human counterpart (military forms may have inbuilt weapons, among other things). Real (as opposed to fictional) cyborgs are more frequently people who use cybernetic technology to repair or overcome the physical and mental constraints of their bodies. While cyborgs are commonly thought of as mammals, they can be any kind of organism. [Source: wiki]

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: humanoid alien
tag.description: Humanoids are aliens, intelligent beings who do not originate from Earth, but have a striking similarity to humans or at least show the basic body layout, i.e. two arms and legs, head with two eyes and ears, one nose and mouth. Though the latter - head-related features - may vary. As "DearS" shows some aliens actually exhibit super-human beauty, or as in the case of "Onegai Teacher" they are genetically compatible to humans for some strange reason.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: genetic modification
tag.description: Story-wise, genetic modification is usually centred on humans, probably the most subtle and creepy way of messing with mankind. Playing with the fear of the unknown, genetically altered humans are technically a new species, that may not only surpass but actually replace unaltered humans. The level of modification will vary from subtle changes in "look" (e.g. super-human beauty), to mental enhancements (PSI powers), to more or less atrocious adaptations to extreme environments (breath under water, radiation resistance). Note that changes in Aliens would be difficult to pinpoint, after all they are alien.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: monologues
tag.description: This show features a noticeable amount of screen time during which characters talk to themselves. That is usually a way to display to the viewers what the characters are thinking. When used in excess, it may be a sign of poor storytelling, but when done skillfully, it may be excellent comedy fuel.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: emotions awaken superpowers
tag.description: During an extreme emotional state — rage, love, hate, angst, sadness, compassion — something inside the character will "click" that will increase greatly his/her power or a new superpower awakes, that surpasses anything achieved by him/her until then.

tag.name: death is cheap
tag.description: Important characters will have a terrible tendency to die dramatically, but will not, under any circumstances, stay dead. This tends to cheapen the dramatic death of a character to the point of being little more than a flesh wound if overused. If you ever hear passing mention of any form of afterlife in a series, be warned that the value of "dead" has become a whole lot less all of a sudden. Similarly, if the entire supporting cast is being killed off left and right, expect a resurrection by the end of the current arc. This trope became so common in some series that most people are more likely to be shocked if a character does not come back from the dead than when it does.

tag.name: everybody dies
tag.description: Not necessarily everyone, but a good portion of the characters kick the bucket.

tag.name: remastered version available
tag.description: This anime has been remastered in a higher quality format than the original release. The remaster may be a simple upscale, or it could be a full enhancement project from the original frames. This is irrespective of whether specific groups have released rips of such formats to the internet.

tag.name: preview before ed
tag.description: Unlike most productions, where the next episode preview rolls *after* the ending with the production credits, this title does the reverse: preview the next episode *first*, then enjoy the ED (or skip it if you prefer, without missing the juicy preview details).

tag.name: talking is a free action
tag.description: Time in comics is flexible. Each panel shows a single event, which is usually accompanied by a length of dialog, which must take some time to say. This disparity is usually accepted if it isn`t taken to extremes. But often, characters will exposit when it`s most needed: at the story`s climax, when both the intricacies of the plot and the intensity of action hit their highest. While the Heroes Outrun the Fireball, Mr. Exposition might explain why the Evil Overlord`s death caused the explosion. The Action Girl can deliver impressive lectures on why the monster`s Achilles` Heel will work, while still engaging in Waif-Fu. The Superhero can quip to his heart`s content and explain his abilities while dueling one insignificant mobster, or deliver a Kirk Summation during the course of a single Finishing Move. Sometimes even apparent mere mortals can give a lecture on what is happening when it would be a much better idea to simply run like hell. Without stopping to breathe, apparently. Source: TvTrope

tag.name: police are useless
tag.description: The civilian law enforcement representatives do not seem to be of much use, when trying to take on the usually vastly superior foes. The "helpless" and often clumsy antics of the police can be used as a comedy element.

tag.name: flashback
tag.description: A flashback is a moment in which someone remembers events from their past. In fiction, flashbacks are used primarily to give insight into a character`s mind or to reveal information which had been previously kept from the audience. They normally consist essentially of new content; in some cases, they may also consist of short snippets of already displayed content, as in http://anidb.net/ch23266 [Okabe Rintarou]`s flashbacks in http://anidb.net/a7729 [Steins;Gate], but even in these cases the flashbacks are used to look into what the character is thinking. As such, they are different from and should not be confused with recaps, which are old content being shown again for no particular purpose other than padding or reminding the audience of the events up to that point. As a rule of thumb, to qualify as a flashback, the scene must advance the show`s content in some way or form; anything else is just a recap.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: time skip
tag.description: The plot features at least one skip or jump in time. Example: A skip from the present into the past, or time skips in increments, e.g. every hour there is a time skip by a day.

tag.name: long time span
tag.description: The anime spans a much longer than usual (for that genre) period of time, typically several years (possibly decades or even centuries). Example: In a school setting this could mean the character development is followed from school through college right into working life and the founding of a family with children.

tag.name: nearly almighty protagonist
tag.description: Man 1: "Hey man, did you see me take down that guy over there, there`s no way he could have survived that!" Man 2: "Yeah I know what you mean, it would take the strength of 1 million men to be able to ..... HE`S GETTING BACK UP!!?!?" *synonymous jaws dropping* This anime`s main character is comparable to the gods themselves in terms of resistibility, strength and/or downright bad-assery. Whenever they seem as if the fire inside has burnt out, they rise from the ashes with enough tenacity and ferocity to vanquish any foe that dare stand against them.

tag.name: put right what once went wrong
complete manga adaptation
tag.description: Anime ends, then manga ends

tag.name: adults are useless
tag.description: For when adults can`t do anything right.

tag.name: endless battles
tag.description:
Battles or tournament matches that last much longer than needed (compared to other genres) - perhaps even spanning several episodes.
Filler scenes are inserted between the action scenes, painfully lengthening the screen time even further. A long roster of characters (main, secondary, even extras) watches the events, expressing their opinions about the development of the match, trying to predict the outcome, explaining the rules to those who do not know them, and showing their amazement by an oh so surprising turn of events.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: end of the world
tag.description: The imminent end of the world may range from the total destruction of the planet Earth, to the destruction of Earth`s surface, or to the point where human life on the planet is no longer possible, aka the end of humanity. In any case it looks grim, and the protagonists battle to preserve what they can.

tag.name: perpetual ongoing
tag.description: No end in sight! No matter what the genre may be or what the storyline consists of, this series just keeps on going... and on... and on. The obvious downside to this is the lack of story-related focus, usually some vague goal is simply never reached. This lack of conclusion can tend to annoy, making the whole series pretty much pointless. Examples: One Piece, Naruto, Bleach, Detective Conan, Dragon Ball (Z), or Pocket Monsters (Pokemon).

tag.name: gotta catch them all
tag.description: A typical plot or sub-plot for many shows. Either the cast or somebody else, that being often the main antagonist, embarks on a quest to collect things, shiny things. Things that are said to grant simple wishes or even do miracles like bringing people back to life, destroying the whole world, galaxy, universe and in rare cases turning the hero into the greatest Pokemon Master. Those things can be weapons, lost technology, magical artefacts, pieces of a giant magical artefact and in some cases even people or little critters. The point is, there`s stuff to collect!

tag.name: the power of love
tag.description: The power of love is not only the strongest power known to mankind, it is the strongest power in the universe. The power of love conquers all things. It makes people cry, it makes people laugh, it can make them sing and occasionally it even brings dead people back to life, just so. More so than the power of friendship, the power of true love gives boundless strength and resolution; by the power of love every hardship can be overcome, every issue can be resolved and it does make people resistant to food poisoning (caused by the bad cooking of their loved ones). Even the big bad evil doesn`t stand a chance against the power of true love and often ends up redeemed. Even when the power of love is not literally and directly responsible, the scene is often set so that the audience is left with the impression that it was "really responsible".

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Kame Sennin
character.description: Kame Sennin is an ancient and wise martial arts master and the first Earthling to wield the Kamehameha. Though he seems frail, he is a mighty warrior, having trained Grandpa Gohan, Gyuumaou, Son Gokuu, and others.

character.name: Son Gokuu
character.description: Son Gokuu is a Saiyajin warrior who was sent to Earth when he was a child.

character.name: Vegeta
character.description: Vegeta is the prince of the Saiyajin race and http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu]`s most fearsome rival. He is a very prideful person and, as a full-blooded saiyajin, loves the prospect of a good battle.

character.name: Kame
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch2085 [Kame Sennin]`s turtle. He`s celebrating his 1000th birthday in http://anidb.net/e16565 [episode 117] of http://anidb.net/a1530 [Dragon Ball Z]

character.name: Oolong
character.description: Oolong is a shapeshifting, anthropomorphic pig that uses his abilities for his own greedy desires. He was expelled from shapeshifting training for stealing the teacher`s underwear, so he lacks the ability to change his form for more than five minutes at a time without a break. He joins with Goku to search for the Dragon Balls and eventually steal them, but he abandons his plans. In Dragon Ball Z, he is often in the company of Roshi.

character.name: Puar
character.description: Puar is a soft-spoken shapeshifting blue creature and the constant companion of Yamcha. He uses his abilities to shapeshift into anything to help Yamcha rob passersby in the desert. Afterwards, he travels with Yamcha and Goku during Dragon Ball, and continues to live with Yamcha afterwards.

character.name: Shenlong
character.description: Shenron is the dragon that appears when someone collects all seven of Earth`s Dragon Balls and calls him forth. He will grant one wish and then vanish, scattering the 7 Dragon Balls throughout the Earth once again.

character.name: Uranai Baba
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch2085 [Kame Sennin]`s older sister.

character.name: Lunch
character.description: Lunch`s calm personality - If she sneezes, it changes to a rather wild one, and her hair becomes blonde. Another sneezer turns her back again.

character.name: Lunch
character.description: Lunch`s wild personality - If she sneezes, it changes to a rather calm one, and her hair becomes blue. Another sneezer turns her back again.

character.name: Super Saiyajin Gokuu
character.description: During the events of Dragon Ball Z, Gokuu becomes the first Super Saiyajin in a millennium after being overcome with rage by the murder of Krillin by the hand of Frieza.

character.name: Super Saiyajin 2 Gokuu
character.description: Gokuu reached the ability to turn into the Super Saiyajin 2 form in the spirit realm, after being killed by Perfect Cell. The only time he really uses this form is in his fight with Majin Vegeta.

character.name: Super Saiyajin 3 Gokuu
character.description: Gokuu first used this transformation in a brief battle against Majin Buu in order to stall him long enough for Trunks to find the Dragon Radar. He was able to overtake the monster, completely outmatching him blow for blow, though the obese version had yet to freely demonstrate his full power by getting angry at the time. He eventually retreated from the fight, as he wanted Goten and Trunks to defeat Buu with their fusion technique, as he "wouldn`t be around forever".

character.name: Freezer
character.description: Freezer was the main antagonist in the Freezer Saga of http://anidb.net/a1530 [Dragon Ball Z]. He`s an alien tyrant with plans of universal domination. He`s cunning, charismatic, arrogant, imperative and, of course, powerful. He possesses different abilities such as ki manipulation and transformation. He also has high survivability, as he could live on even when wounded and thrown away into outer space.

character.name: Son Gohan
character.description: Gohan is introduced as the first son of the primary protagonist, Son Goku, and his wife, Chi Chi, in volume #17 of the original manga, or the premiere episode of its animated adaptation, Dragon Ball Z. Gohan is the first Saiyan/Human hybrid in the series. As opposed to full-blooded Saiyans, whose hair stays the same from birth, Gohan`s is drawn at varying lengths, and changes markedly in style. Many of Yamcha`s hairstyles are used by Gohan at various points in his life. Initially, Gohan is illustrated garbed in a Hanfu-like surcoat with the Chinese character 孫, fixed on the front and the four-star Dragon Ball fitted on top of his hat. Piccolo later supplies him with a keikogi fashioned after Goku`s, but substitutes it with the demon character "魔" as a sign of his admission into the Demon Tribe. Normally thereafter, Gohan is drawn with a keikogi modeled after Piccolo`s own, with the anime recoloring his wristbands from blue to red and, during the Cell Games tournament, his obi from red to blue, despite reverting to the original colors for the former. On Namek, Gohan is portrayed in battle armor worn by Frieza`s henchmen, having been given it by Vegeta in preparation for their encounter with Frieza. Prior to his second fight with Majin Buu, Gohan asks Kibito for an outfit resembling his father`s, and is then drawn in a keikogi identical to Goku`s.

character.name: Bubbles
character.description: Bubbles is the monkey pet of Kaiou. He serves a special purpose during Kaiou`s training lessons, particularly one of two endurance tests, where trainees are instructed to chase after Bubbles in an effort to catch him. His name is a reference to Michael Jackson`s pet monkey, who is also named Bubbles.

character.name: Gregory
character.description: Gregory is a little flying cricket and http://anidb.net/ch11407 [Kaiou]`s pet. He only appears in the anime and in a few movies.

character.name: Kaiou
character.description: Kaiou is the kaiou of the northern quadrant of the galaxy. His companion is a pet monkey named http://anidb.net/ch11405 [Bubbles] and in anime adaptation, http://anidb.net/a1530 [Dragon Ball Z], he also has a flying cricket companion named http://anidb.net/ch11406 [Gregory]. If a fighter that was allowed to keep his body manages to reach his small planet at the end of Hebi no Michi (Snake Way in the English adaptations), Kaiou trains them. Before training any students though, he forces them to appeal to his strange sense of humor, catch Bubbles, and hit Gregory with a mallet.

character.name: Chaozu
character.description: Chaozu is a small human that resembles a doll with white skin, red cheeks, and one hair under his hat. Though he is not physically strong, he is skilled with psychokinesis and telepathy

character.name: Chichi
character.description: Chichi is very protective over the well being of her family, and wishes to remove them from http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu]`s lifestyle of fighting and constant conflict. As the daughter of http://anidb.net/ch11411 [Gyuumaou] (Ox-King), she is very strong in her own right, having easily made it to the quarter-finals of the 23rd Tenkaichi Budoukai.

character.name: Enma Daiou
character.description: Enma Daiou is the boss of all ogres, who judge the dead. He is based on the Hindu deity Yama. A line of souls leads to his office where he decides whether a soul goes to Heaven or Hell. Compared to the other oni, he is of a different colour, he wears a beard, he has two horns and a helmet (it is unclear whether the horns are his own or belong to the helm), and he is colossal in size.

character.name: Gyuumaou
character.description: Despite his threatening sounding name, Ox-King is really quite harmless and fun loving. He was somewhat demonic when his castle became engulfed in flames on Fire Mountain during a picnic with his daughter, and wreaked havoc through the village at the foot of the mountain. He is Chichi`s biological father and thus, Gokuu`s father-in-law. He is very strong and trained alongside Grandpa Gohan under Kame Sennin`s tutelage.

character.name: Kamisama
character.description: Kami-sama is the guardian residing over the Earth for much of the series. He is the good half of an unnamed Namekian that had to split himself in order to become guardian. The evil half, http://anidb.net/ch22168 [Piccolo Daimaou] was later sealed away by humans.

character.name: Karin
character.description: Karin is a Senbyou (immortal cat) and is at least 800 years old when introduced in Dragon Ball. He is a deity who lives at the top of Karin Tower. The tower is located right underneath Kami`s palace.

character.name: Kuririn
character.description: Kuririn is introduced in Dragon Ball as a rival of the main character, http://anidb.net/ch2116 [Son Gokuu]. Later in the series, he develops a close relationship with him as well as his son, http://anidb.net/ch11419 [Gohan].

character.name: Nappa
character.description: Nappa is an elite Saiyajin warrior from the Planet Vegeta, and http://anidb.net/ch2105 [Vegeta]`s partner in combat. Prior to the destruction of Planet Vegeta, Nappa was the General of the Saiyajin army and aid/partner to the young http://anidb.net/ch2105 [Prince Vegeta] as well. His name is a pun off of Chinese cabbage.

character.name: Piccolo
character.description: Piccolo, whose full name is Piccolo Jr., was first introduced as the reincarnation of the evil http://anidb.net/ch22168 [Piccolo Daimaou] in http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], making him a demon and arch-rival of the primary protagonist, http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Son Gokuu]. However, it is later revealed that he is from the race of alien beings called Namekians and he decides to team up with http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu] and his friends in order to beat newer, more dangerous threats.

character.name: Mr. Popo
character.description: He is an immortal genie who tends the grounds of Kami`s Lookout and is bound there eternally as the gardener and caretaker. He uses a magic carpet for Instant Transportation. Though he may not appear to physically age, Mr. Popo is very old; having served Kami, the Guardian of Earth for hundreds of years, he also served Kami`s predecessor, as well as every other guardian of the Earth in the past. Being the loyal and faithful servant that he is, his purpose consists mainly of tending to Kami`s Palace, keeping the Lookout clean, helping to reconstruct Shenron if needed, and most importantly, taking care of Kami. He also tends to the ancient butterfly garden that he planted thousands of years ago, and enjoys the more simple things in life.

character.name: Raditz
character.description: Raditz works alongside http://anidb.net/ch2105 [Vegeta] and http://anidb.net/ch11415 [Nappa], and is essentially a warrior in http://anidb.net/ch9009 [Freezer]`s army. While working on a team led by http://anidb.net/ch2105 [Vegeta], Raditz traveled to Earth to find out if http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu] had finished the mission that he was sent on as a baby: the overthrow of Earth.

character.name: Son Gohan
character.description: Gohan is introduced at the age of 4 as the first son of the primary protagonist, http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Son Gokuu], and his wife, http://anidb.net/ch11409 [Chichi].

character.name: Tenshinhan
character.description: Initially an enemy of Goku who was trained by Kame Sennin`s rival Tsuru Sennin, Tenshinhan soon makes peace with Goku and becomes a Z Fighter along with his friend Chaozu.

character.name: Yajirobe
character.description: Yajirobe is an overweight samurai that Goku meets in Dragon Ball. He is often considered to be rude, unmannered, timid, lazy, and cowardly. He helps Goku prepare for the battle against Piccolo Daimao, and continues to support Goku and his companions, though often from the sideline

character.name: Yamucha
character.description: Yamucha is introduced as an outlaw and starts out as an antagonist of Son Goku`s in order to steal his Dragon Ball and wish not to feel nervous when being near to women. He eventually reforms, becoming an ally and Z Fighter.

character.name: Zarbon
character.description: Zarbon is one of Freezer`s top two henchmen. He has the ability to transform into a powerful reptilian beast.

character.name: Dodoria
character.description: Dodoria is one of Freezer`s top two henchmen, the other being Zarbon.

character.name: Cui
character.description: Cui is one of Freezer`s henchmen and was initially Vegeta`s rival in the years he was working under Freezer.

character.name: Dende
character.description: Dende is a Namekian child saved from Dodoria by Gohan and Kuririn. He has the ability to heal wounds.

character.name: Muri
character.description: Muri is the Elder of Dende`s village. After the death of the original Great Elder, he becomes Great Elder of the new generation.

character.name: Briefs Hakase
character.description: Dr. Brief is an elderly, brilliant and eccentric scientist. He is Bulma`s father and founder of Capsule Corporation.

character.name: Bulma no Haha
character.description: Bulma`s Mother`s primary role in the series is to take on a housewife-esque role at Capsule Corporation, not working and simply being the wife of a rich scientist. Her name is unknown.

character.name: Saichourou
character.description: Saichourou is the oldest and wisest remaining Namekian in existence. After surviving a catastrophic climate shift several hundred years prior to the events in the series as last of his kind on the planet, he gave birth to more than 100 Namekians since then.

character.name: Nail
character.description: Nail is described as the last `fighter class` Namekian left. He is the personal bodyguard to Saichourou, and is very strong for a Namekian

character.name: Appule
character.description: Appule is one of Freezer`s henchmen.

character.name: Videl
character.description: Videl is the daughter of Hercule. Like her father, she trains in martial arts, even surpassing him in strength. She uses her abilities to fight crime in the city, and after Gohan appears as the Great Saiyaman, she quickly figures out his identity. She uses that to blackmail him into showing her how to fly. After Buu is fully defeated, the two form a relationship, eventually become married, and have a child named Pan. When the two fight crime together afterwards, she takes on the role of the "Great Saiyaman 2 or Great Saiyawoman".

character.name: Mr. Satan
character.description: Mr. Satan (known as Hercule in the English adaptations) is a flamboyant martial artist. After http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu] and his companions stop attending the Tenkaichi Budoukai, Mr. Satan starts winning them and becomes the reigning champion for many years. On a Q&A with mangaka http://anidb.net/cr1902 [Toriyama Akira] published in Super Exciting Guide - Character Volume on April 3, 2009, it is revealed that Mr. Satan is just a stage/ring name and that his actual first name is "Mark". While it seems like a common name, it is actually written out in katakana as マーク (maaku). If you rearrange the syllables, as you would with many names in the series to derive their puns, you end up with akuma (meaning "devil" or "demon"), which is in concordance with his daughter`s name being a pun on the English word "devil". During the Cell Games, he attempts to fight http://anidb.net/ch24822 [Cell], but even after being swatted away, he is given credit for Cell`s death by the media. He is soon called a world hero, gaining great wealth and a city named after him. Though Gokuu and his companions find his inflated ego and arrogance very annoying, he becomes close to them after befriending the good http://anidb.net/ch41758 [Majin Buu] and by helping defeat Kid Buu by using his appeal to the people of Earth to get energy for the Genki Dama. His daughter, http://anidb.net/ch12209 [Videl], marries http://anidb.net/ch9915 [Gohan].

character.name: Ginyu
character.description: Ginyu is leader of the Ginyu Tokusentai (Ginyu Special Force) and posses the "Body Change" abillity to transfer his mind into another body.

character.name: Reacoom
character.description: Recoome is the most flamboyant member of the "Ginyu Force", seen striking poses more often in battle than Ginyu himself, and generally behaving in a deceptively goofy manner. However Recoome is actually fairly intelligent, as well as sadistic, and he greatly enjoys toying with his opponents and drawing them in with taunts.

character.name: Jeese
character.description: Jheese is an extremely flamboyant and showy white-haired mutant who is humanoid in appearance apart from his red skin. Nicknamed the "Red Magma", he often pairs with Burter for combination attacks.

character.name: Burter
character.description: Burter is the tallest member of the "Ginyu Force". He is the self-proclaimed "Azure Typhoon" and fancies himself the fastest being in the universe next to Freezer.

character.name: Gurd
character.description: Gurd is the smallest and least powerful member of the "Ginyu Force" physically; a short, rotund, and green alien with four eyes (which prevents him from wearing a scouter like the other members). Though clearly the weakest member of the group, Gurd possesses some psychic abilities, including being able to stop time for as long as he can hold his breath. This seems to be one of the primary reasons he has attained membership to the "Ginyu Force".

character.name: Ginyu Tokusentai
character.description: The Ginyu Tokusentai (or Ginyu Force) is a team of five mercenaries who are hired by Freezer. Though physically some of the strongest individuals in the universe, the Ginyu Force`s members delight in coming up with strange poses, betting candy on fights, and playing Janken.

character.name: Trunks
character.description: Son of Vegeta and Bulma; came from the future.

character.name: Porunga
character.description: Porunga is the Eternal Dragon of Namek summoned when all the Dragon Balls of Namek are gathered. Compared to the Dragon Balls of Earth, the Namekian Dragon Balls are quite large, being more towards the size of a basketball rather than the size of a small grapefruit.

character.name: Jinzouningen 16 Gou
character.description: Jinzouningen 16 Gou (Android #16 in the English adaptations) is a large cyborg with red hair and a green armor. Unlike other jinzouningen, he is gentle by nature, a fact that deemed him a failure in http://anidb.net/ch18381 [Dr. Gero]`s eyes. He was programmed with the sole objective of killing http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Son Gokuu]. He was awakened by http://anidb.net/ch19620 [Jinzouningen 17 Gou] and http://anidb.net/ch19619 [Jinzouningen 18 Gou], much to Gero`s dismay. While he was much stronger than the two, he still took orders from the duo. On a Q&A with mangaka http://anidb.net/cr1902 [Toriyama Akira] published April 4th, 2014, it was revealed that Jinzouningen 16 Gou was modeled after Dr. Gero`s own son who died young long ago. He was a high-ranking soldier in the Red Ribbon Army, but he was felled by an enemy bullet. Having a special place in his heart for his own child, Gero gave No. 16 great power and a fearsome explosive mechanism, but not wanting him to be destroyed in battle if possible, he gave him a gentle personality, which caused No. 16 to become a failure. He helped Jinzouningen 18 Gou escape from http://anidb.net/ch22205 [Cell], and watched the Cell Games after she was absorbed, vowing to stop Cell. His body is destroyed by http://anidb.net/ch24822 [Cell], however, his head survives and requests that http://anidb.net/ch12210 [Mr. Satan] throw him over to the fight, to help http://anidb.net/ch39296 [Gohan] control himself. Cell completely destroys him after he gets his word in, crushing his head and pushing Gohan over the edge to Super Saiyan 2. In http://anidb.net/ch13302 [Future Trunks]` timeline, Jinzouningen 16 Gou was never activated.

character.name: Jinzouningen 18 Gou
character.description: Jinzouningen 18 Gou (Android #18 in the English adaptations) is a fictional character who first appears in the Dragon Ball manga created by http://anidb.net/cr1902 [Toriyama Akira], followed by the shows http://anidb.net/a1530 [Dragon Ball Z] and http://anidb.net/a233 [Dragon Ball GT]. She is a mass murderer in http://anidb.net/ch13302 [Future Trunks]` timeline. Originally a human, she and her brother were modified into cyborgs by http://anidb.net/ch18381 [Dr. Gero]. On a Q&A with mangaka http://anidb.net/cr1902 [Toriyama Akira] published May 2nd, 2014 it was revealed that her human name was Lazuli. After http://anidb.net/ch20915 [Cell] is defeated, http://anidb.net/ch11414 [Kuririn] uses the Dragon Balls to wish for her and her brother to be turned into humans; http://anidb.net/ch7015 [Shenron] is unable to perform this task because of the unfathomable differences in power between him and the duo, so he wishes instead for their self destruct devices to be removed. Kuririn pursues her and, at some point, they marry and have a daughter named http://anidb.net/ch30874 [Marron]. To clear up the heavily espoused misconception that she is a pure android and therefore could not have a child, Kuririn went on to explain to http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Son Gokuu] during the Tenkaichi Budoukai Saga that she was originally human but that Dr. Gero just "remodeled her a little bit."

character.name: Jinzouningen 17 Gou
character.description: Jinzouningen 17 Gou (Android #17 in the English adaptations) is a fictional character who first appears in the Dragon Ball manga created by http://anidb.net/cr1902 [Toriyama Akira], followed by the shows http://anidb.net/a1530 [Dragon Ball Z] and http://anidb.net/a233 [Dragon Ball GT]. He is a mass murderer in http://anidb.net/ch13302 [Future Trunks]` timeline. Originally a human, he and his sister were modified into cyborgs by http://anidb.net/ch18381 [Dr. Gero]. On a Q&A with mangaka http://anidb.net/cr1902 [Toriyama Akira] published May 2nd, 2014 it was revealed that his human name was Lapis. During the events of the Jinzouningen & Cell arc, he and his sister drive around in a van with http://anidb.net/ch19618 [Jinzouningen 16 Gou], looking for http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu]. When they finally get to the Kame House, http://anidb.net/ch11416 [Piccolo] tells them Gokuu is not there and refuses to tell them where he went. Piccolo then challenges him to a battle and as they fight, Piccolo`s ki leads http://anidb.net/ch20915 [Cell] (who needs to absorb both jinzouningen to reach its perfect form) to the battlefield. Cell tells Jinzouningen 17 Gou to surrender so he can become a part of "greatness". He refuses and is then defeated during the ensuing battle. After Cell is defeated, http://anidb.net/ch11414 [Kuririn] uses the Dragon Balls to wish for him and his sister to be turned into humans; http://anidb.net/ch7015 [Shenron] is unable to perform this task because of the unfathomable differences in power between him and the duo, so he wishes instead for their self destruct devices to be removed.

character.name: Cell
character.description: Cell is the ultimate creation of Doctor Gero. He is an artificial life form created using the cells of several characters from the series, including Goku, Piccolo and Frieza. As a result, Cell is able to perform techniques such as the Kamehameha, a powerful energy blast which he gains from the cells of Goku. In creating the character of Cell, Toriyama tried many different designs before finally settling on the one used in the series. Cell evolves several times throughout his appearances. He originally evolves from a cocoon-like form into his first "Imperfect Form", which is insect-like in appearance. Both his first form and his second "Semi-Perfect Form" have a long tail that ends in a stinger-like appendage and allows it to absorb other organisms. The tail recedes under his wings in his final "Perfect Form", and he can use it to spawn Cell Jr., a minuscule child-like version of himself.

character.name: Cold Daiou
character.description: King Cold is the father of Freezer. Not much is known about him, in fact few even know of his existence.

character.name: Jinzouningen 8 Gou
character.description: One of http://anidb.net/ch18381 [Dr. Gero]`s early creations. He refuses to fight http://anidb.net/ch2116 [Gokuu] when told to, and instead helps him. The two quickly become friends.

character.name: Piccolo Daimaou
character.description: Piccolo Daimaou is the evil counterpart of http://anidb.net/ch11412 [Kami-sama]. He was sealed in an electric rice cooker by Mutaito to stop his reign of terror on Earth. He was released centuries later and started terrorizing the Earth yet again. http://anidb.net/ch2116 [Gokuu] ends up killing him to stop him. Before dying he transferred his essence into an egg which later hatches into http://anidb.net/ch11416 [Piccolo Jr].

character.name: Cell
character.description: Second form of Cell.

character.name: Son Goten
character.description: Goten is first introduced at age 7, basically appearing out of nowhere. He is the second son of Goku and ChiChi, and it is said he was born shortly before Goku died. There is no explanation as to why he was never shown or mentioned earlier.

character.name: Cell
character.description: Final form of Cell

character.name: Trunks
character.description: Trunks` Super Saiyajin version.

character.name: Super Saiyajin Vegeta
character.description: Vegeta`s Super Saiyajin version.

character.name: Garlic Junior
character.description: Garlic Jr. is a Makyo-Jin from the Makyo Star. He uses the Dragon Balls to obtain immortality to avenge his father and conquer the Earth.

character.name: Oozaru Gohan
character.description: Gohan`s Oozaru, or Great Ape, form. He only transforms when he looks at the full moon when he has his tail. Unlike his normal peaceful self, he is vicious and destructive in this form.

character.name: Marron
character.description: Marron is the daughter of http://anidb.net/ch30875 [Kuririn] and http://anidb.net/ch19619 [Jinzouningen 18 Gou].

character.name: Kuririn
character.description: Kuririn eventually settles down and marries Android #18 after the Cell Games to have a child named Marron. He also finally lets his hair grow out.

character.name: Super Saiyajin Gohan
character.description: Gohan is introduced at the age of 4 as the first son of the primary protagonist, Son Gokuu, and his wife, Chichi.

character.name: Super Saiyajin 2 Gohan
character.description: Gohan is introduced at the age of 4 as the first son of the primary protagonist, Son Gokuu, and his wife, Chichi.

character.name: Great Saiyaman
character.description: The Great Saiyaman is Son Gohan`s superhero disguise to hide his identity from his classmates.

character.name: Bibidi
character.description: Bibidi is the wizard responsible for creating http://anidb.net/ch41758 [Majin Buu].

character.name: Uub
character.description: Uub is Son Gokuu`s apprentice. While launching the final blow to kill http://anidb.net/ch104276 [Majin Buu], Gokuu wishes for Buu to come back as a better person. http://anidb.net/ch13985 [Porunga] grants the wish by reincarnating Buu as a human with a good nature.

character.name: Kibito Kaioushin
character.description: Kibito Kaioushin is a result of Potara Fusion between http://anidb.net/ch67299 [Kaioushin] and his servant http://anidb.net/ch67300 [Kibito]. His personality is for the most part similar to the Kaioushin`s, except the unusual amount of concern he had for the damage the fight with http://anidb.net/ch41758 [Buu] was doing to his planet. Source: Dragon Ball Wikia

character.name: Vegetto
character.description: Vegetto is the immensely powerful result of the fusion between Goku and Vegeta by the use of the Potara Earrings.

character.name: Pan
character.description: Pan is the granddaughter of http://anidb.net/ch2103 [Gokuu] and daughter of http://anidb.net/ch9915 [Gohan] and http://anidb.net/ch12209 [Videl]. She is a major character in http://anidb.net/a233 [Dragon Ball GT] along with Gokuu and http://anidb.net/ch13302 [Trunks].

character.name: Shin
character.description: Shin is the kaioushin of Universe 7; because of that, his life is linked to that of http://anidb.net/ch53774 [Beerus]. In Dragon Ball Z, he was one of five kaioushin of the universe, known as Higashi no Kaioushin and subordinate to http://anidb.net/ch107117 [Dai Kaioushin]. However, when http://anidb.net/ch104276 [Maijin Buu] appeared, three of his peers were killed and Buu absorbed Dai Kaioushin, making the surviving Shin the de facto Dai Kaioushin. In Dragon Ball Super, the concept of five kaioushin is ignored and the terms Dai Kaioushin and Higashi no Kaioushin are never used. Instead, the show introduces figures similar to Shin from each universe and refers to them each of them simply as kaioushin.

character.name: Kibito
character.description: Kibito is the assistant of http://anidb.net/ch67299 [Shin].

character.name: Bulma
character.description: Bulma from future.

character.name: Freezer
character.description: Freezer`s true form.

character.name: Announcer
character.description: Jimmy Firecracker is the ZTV announcer who gave a play-by-play of the Cell Games.

character.name: Olibu
character.description: Olibu (オリブー Oribū) is a deceased fighter from the North Area in the universe. He is King Kai`s greatest fighter next to Goku.

character.name: Snow
character.description: Now an adult, Snow reappears in Dragon Ball Z, when Goku asks for energy for the Super Spirit Bomb to defeat Kid Buu. She is at Jingle Village with Android 8 and the Jingle Village Chief when giving energy for Goku`s Super Spirit Bomb.

character.name: Majin Buu (Junsui)
character.description: Kid Buu (魔人ブウ （純粋） Majin Bū (Junsui), lit. "Demon Person Boo (Pure)") is the original, pure form of Majin Buu. Unlike his other forms, this form of Buu`s thought process is seen to be irrational and spontaneous, even destroying his own body to destroy the Earth. Although he appears smaller than any other form, he is more dangerous than any other forms of Buu due to his full relentless evil and unpredictability. He is also completely free of restraint and has no trace of sanity and, because of this, is extremely volatile. He retains his childish personality, becoming amused and laughing hysterically at his own destruction of entire worlds. He is the main antagonist for the Kid Buu Saga as well as the final antagonist of the Majin Buu Saga. (Source: http://dragonball.fandom.com/wiki/Kid_Buu)

character.name: Majin Buu (Junsui Aku)
character.description: Evil Buu (魔人ブウ （純粋悪） Majin Bū (Junsui Aku), lit. "Demon Person Boo (Pure Evil)") was a tall, thin, gray, emaciated creature which appeared after Majin Buu dispelled the evil from his body. (Source: http://dragonball.fandom.com/wiki/Evil_Buu )

character.name: Majin Buu (Aku)
character.description: Super Buu (超ブウ Chō Bū, lit. "Super Boo"), also called Majin Buu (Evil) (魔人ブウ （悪） Majin Bū (Aku), lit. "Majin Boo (Evil)"), is the result of Evil Buu eating Good Buu in a chocolate form. This new Majin Buu has tremendously more power and increased mental capacity than the previous incarnation. In this form, Buu has very little patience and extremely dangerous fits of anger, even possessing the power to rip through dimensional walls if angered enough. He is the main antagonist for the Fusion Saga part of the Majin Buu Arc. (Source: http://dragonball.fandom.com/wiki/Super_Buu )

character.name: Freezer Gun
character.description: Freezer Gun is the organisation controlled a majority of Universe 7 at the peak of its power and serves as the primary antagonistic force of the first half of the Dragon Ball Z series. Freezer`s father, Cold Daio was the leader of the organisation prior to passing control over to his son. The organisation employs and enslaves powerful races, such as the Saiyans, to take over suitable planets so that they can be sold to the highest bidders, or alternatively to destroy planets which are determined to be not financially viable. Freezer`s forces are equipped with scouters, portable computers mainly used to measure power levels, and wear standard-issue battle armor which usually have dual shoulder guards, matching gloves and Buuts, and some form of skirt armor or crotch guard. Freezer himself does not really consider his soldiers as an army, looking at them more as a convenient group of followers. In reality, the soldiers follow him and his relatives out of fear, though some soldiers are known to be fiercely loyal to Freezer such as the Ginyu Force. Source: Wikipedia When Freezer took over the business from his father in 732, most of the soldiers came from Planet Vegeta. However, Freezer became fearful of the power of the saiyajin and worked to make the army less saiyajin reliant. In five years from his accession, he destroyed Planet Vegeta, and cutting the size of the army in half. In 762, the army took heavy losses while fighting on Planet Namek for the Dragon Balls, but was ultimately defeated. In 764, the army attempt to invade Planet Earth, which proved even more fatal, as Freezer and Cold Daio were slain. Hence the army has reduced to a rump under http://anidb.net/ch72561 [Sorbet]. In 779, the army had become a shadow of its former self, as many words had liberated themselves. Thus Sorbet made a desperate attempt to fix the empire by resurrecting Freezer with the help of the Dragon Balls. However, Freezer was disinterested in fixing his empire and instead set on wasting the remaining resources of the army in order to pursue vengeance; a decision which ended in his, Sorbet`s and the bulk of the army`s soldiers` deaths. In 780, when Freezer was resurrected for the second time, with the guidance of http://anidb.net/ch105587 [Beriblu] and http://anidb.net/ch105586 [Kikono], he decided to rebuild the army.

episode.summary: In this film, the two Saiyans discuss the first three movies of Dragon Ball (Curse of the Blood Rubies, Sleeping Princess in Devil`s Castle, and Mystical Adventure) and the first seven of Dragon Ball Z (Dead Zone, The World`s Strongest, The Tree of Might, Lord Slug, Cooler`s Revenge, The Return of Cooler, and Super Android 13!). In the end, Goku does not much like being all dressed up and powers up to change back into his regular martial arts uniform. Gohan tries to do like his father, but he is not powerful enough to get out of his tuxedo. Goku says he will get there someday, and Gohan tells everyone to be sure to go see Dragon Ball Z: Super Android 13! in theaters.
